alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Douglas; Edgar; Vermilion (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 4:19AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Edgar, southern Vermilion, southern Champaign and Douglas Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 419 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sidell to near Pesotum. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sidell around 425 AM CDT. Georgetown and Ridge Farm around 430 AM CDT. Chrisman around 435 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Camargo, Hindsboro, Newman, Hume, Brocton and Redmon. This includes Interstate 57 between mile markers 202 and 224. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Lincoln. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for central and east central Illinois.
